abstract: Humanitarian relief officials announce Britain may accelerate process of admitting dozens of unaccompanied refugee children living in so-called Jungle migrant camp outside Calais, France, in effort to reunite them with their relatives across English Channel; France is struggling to find places for about 10,000 migrants in camp, around 1,000 of whom are unaccompanied children, in advance of dismantling it.

headline.print_headline: Movement by Britain on Migrant Children
headline.main: Migrant Children, Alone and Desperate in Calais, Look to Britain With Hope

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

snippet: With the French government’s planned dismantling of the migrant camp looming, officials say Britain may finally be accelerating steps to admit dozens of children....
lead_paragraph: With the French government’s planned dismantling of the migrant camp looming, officials say Britain may finally be accelerating steps to admit dozens of children.
